info: Set a default character name that will be used instead of a random name on character creation.
name: DEF_CHAR_NAME

info: If true, enable item auto pickup.  Change pickup rules with the Auto pickup manager.
name: AUTO_PICKUP

info: If true, enable auto pickup items one tile around to the player.  You can assign No Auto Pickup zones with the Zones manager for e.g. your homebase.
name: AUTO_PICKUP_ADJACENT

info: If true, items that belong to your faction will be included in auto pickup.
name: AUTO_PICKUP_OWNED

info: Auto pickup items with weight less than or equal to [option] * 50 grams.  You must also set the small items option.  0 = disabled.
name: AUTO_PICKUP_WEIGHT_LIMIT

info: Auto pickup items with volume less than or equal to [option] * 50 milliliters.  You must also set the light items option.  0 = disabled.
name: AUTO_PICKUP_VOLUME_LIMIT

info: If true, auto pickup is disabled as long as you can see monsters nearby.  This is affected by 'Safe mode proximity distance'.
name: AUTO_PICKUP_SAFEMODE

info: If true, you will see messages about items you step on, within no auto pickup zones.
name: NO_AUTO_PICKUP_ZONES_LIST_ITEMS

info: If true, enables configured auto features below.  Disabled as long as any enemy monster is seen.
name: AUTO_FEATURES

info: Action to perform when 'Auto pulp or butcher' is enabled.  Pulp: Pulp corpses you stand on.  - Pulp Adjacent: Also pulp corpses adjacent from you.  - Butcher: Butcher corpses you stand on.
default: Default: off - Values: off, pulp, pulp_zombie_only, pulp_adjacent, pulp_adjacent_zombie_only, butcher
name: AUTO_PULP_BUTCHER

info: If true, enables automatic use of wielded pickaxes and jackhammers whenever trying to move into mineable terrain.
name: AUTO_MINING

info: If true, enables automatic use of wielded mops to clean surrounding terrain.
name: AUTO_MOPPING

info: Action to perform when 'Auto foraging' is enabled.  Bushes: Only forage bushes.  - Trees: Only forage trees.  - Crops: Only forage crops.  - Everything: Forage bushes, trees, crops, and everything else including flowers, cattails etc.
default: Default: off - Values: off, bushes, trees, crops, all
name: AUTO_FORAGING

info: If true, will allow player to pick new items, even if it causes them to exceed the weight limit.
name: DANGEROUS_PICKUPS

info: Always: You will be prompted to move onto dangerous tiles.  Running: You will only be able to move onto dangerous tiles while running and will be prompted.  Crouching: You will only be able to move onto a dangerous tile while crouching and will be prompted.  Never:  You will not be able to move onto a dangerous tile unless running and will not be warned or prompted.
default: Default: ALWAYS - Values: ALWAYS, RUNNING, CROUCHING, NEVER
name: DANGEROUS_TERRAIN_WARNING_PROMPT

info: If enabled, turn off the smart engine controller when you turn off the engine of the car without an electric motor.
default: Default: ask - Values: disabled, enabled, ask
name: FORCE_SMART_CONTROLLER_OFF_ON_ENGINE_STOP

info: If true, will hold the game and display a warning if a hostile monster/NPC is approaching.
name: SAFEMODE

info: If safe mode is enabled, distance to hostiles at which safe mode should show a warning.  0 = Max player view distance.  This option only has effect when no safe mode rule is specified.  Otherwise, edit the default rule in Safe mode manager instead of this value.
name: SAFEMODEPROXIMITY

info: If true, safe mode will alert you of hostiles while you are driving a vehicle.
name: SAFEMODEVEH

info: If true, safe mode will automatically reactivate after a certain number of turns.  See option 'Turns to auto reactivate safe mode.'
name: AUTOSAFEMODE

info: Number of turns after which safe mode is reactivated.  Will only reactivate if no hostiles are in 'Safe mode proximity distance.'
name: AUTOSAFEMODETURNS

info: Number of turns an ignored monster stays ignored after it is no longer seen.  0 disables this option and monsters are permanently ignored.
name: SAFEMODEIGNORETURNS

info: If higher than 0, monsters will take periodic gameplay turns.  This value is the delay between each turn, in seconds.  Works best with Safe Mode disabled.  0 = disabled.
name: TURN_DURATION

info: If true, game will periodically save the map.  Autosaves occur based on in-game turns or realtime minutes, whichever is larger.
name: AUTOSAVE

info: Number of game turns between autosaves.
name: AUTOSAVE_TURNS

info: Number of realtime minutes between autosaves.
name: AUTOSAVE_MINUTES

info: If true, automatically sets notes.
name: AUTO_NOTES

info: If true, automatically sets notes on places that have stairs that go up or down.
name: AUTO_NOTES_STAIRS

info: If true, automatically sets notes on places that contain various map extras.
name: AUTO_NOTES_MAP_EXTRAS

info: If true, automatically sets notes when player drops favorited items.
name: AUTO_NOTES_DROPPED_FAVORITES

info: If true, the game will calculate range in a realistic way: light sources will be circles, diagonal movement will cover more ground and take longer.  If false, everything is square: moving to the northwest corner of a building takes as long as moving to the north wall.
name: CIRCLEDIST

info: Set to drop empty containers after use.  No: Don't drop any.  - Watertight: All except watertight containers.  - All: Drop all containers.
default: Default: no - Values: no, watertight, all
name: DROP_EMPTY

info: Always: Always start deathcam.  Ask: Query upon death.  Never: Never show deathcam.
default: Default: ask - Values: always, ask, never
name: DEATHCAM

info: If not disabled, unique items and/or monsters can spawn during special events (Christmas, Halloween, etc.)
default: Default: off - Values: off, items, monsters, both
name: EVENT_SPAWNS

info: If true, music and sound are enabled.
name: SOUND_ENABLED

info: Choose the soundpack you want to use.  Requires restart.
name: SOUNDPACKS

info: Adjust the volume of the music being played in the background.
name: MUSIC_VOLUME

info: Adjust the volume of sound effects being played by the game.
name: SOUND_EFFECT_VOLUME

info: Adjust the volume of ambient sounds being played by the game.
name: AMBIENT_SOUND_VOLUME

info: Switch language.  Each percentage is the fraction of strings translated for that language.
name: USE_LANG

info: Switch between Fahrenheit, Celsius, and Kelvin.
default: Default: fahrenheit - Values: fahrenheit, celsius, kelvin
name: USE_CELSIUS

info: Switch between mph, km/h, and tiles/turn.
default: Default: mph - Values: mph, km/h, t/t
name: USE_METRIC_SPEEDS

info: Switch between lbs and kg.
name: USE_METRIC_WEIGHTS

info: Switch between the cups (c), liters (L), and quarts (qt).
default: Default: l - Values: c, l, qt
name: VOLUME_UNITS

info: Switch between metric and imperial distance units.
name: DISTANCE_UNITS

info: 12h: AM/PM, e.g. 7:31 AM - Military: 24h Military, e.g. 0731 - 24h: Normal 24h, e.g. 7:31
name: 24_HOUR

info: Show messages about items lying on the ground when character steps on tile with them.
name: LOG_ITEMS_ON_THE_GROUND

info: Show messages about special monster movement: flying over the fence, diving into the water etc.
name: LOG_MONSTER_MOVEMENT

info: Show messages about monster trying to free itself from effects preventing it from moving: downed, tied etc.
name: LOG_MONSTER_MOVE_EFFECTS

info: Show messages about non-playable creatures attacking other non-playable creatures.
name: LOG_MONSTER_ATTACK_MONSTER

info: If true, show brand names for guns, instead of generic functional names - 'm4a1' or 'h&k416a5' instead of 'NATO assault rifle'.
name: SHOW_GUN_VARIANTS

info: If true, the default ammo is added to weapon and magazine names.  For example "Mosin-Nagant M44 (4/5)" becomes "Mosin-Nagant M44 (4/5 7.62x54mm)".
name: AMMO_IN_NAMES

info: All: every container has detailed remaining volume info.  - Worn: only worn containers have detailed remaining volume info.  - None: no additional info is provided.
default: Default: WORN - Values: ALL, WORN, NONE
name: DETAILED_CONTAINERS

info: Use key code or symbol input on SDL.  Symbol is recommended for non-qwerty layouts since currently the default keybindings for key code mode only supports qwerty.  Key code is currently WIP and bypasses IMEs, caps lock, and num lock.
name: SDL_KEYBOARD_MODE

info: If true, pinyin (pronunciation of Chinese characters) can be used in searching/filtering (may cause major slowdown when searching through too many entries.)
name: USE_PINYIN_SEARCH

info: If true, prompts such as Y/N queries only accepts capital or modified letters, while lower case and unmodified letters only snap the cursor to the corresponding option.
name: FORCE_CAPITAL_YN

info: If true, automatically follow the crosshair when firing/throwing.
name: SNAP_TO_TARGET

info: If true, after firing automatically aim again if targets are available.
name: AIM_AFTER_FIRING

info: If true, will query before disassembling items while butchering.
name: QUERY_DISASSEMBLE

info: If true, will query before removing a keybinding from a hotkey.
name: QUERY_KEYBIND_REMOVAL

info: If true, will close the advanced inventory when the move all items command is used.
name: CLOSE_ADV_INV

info: If true, open default advanced inventory layout instead of last opened layout
name: OPEN_DEFAULT_ADV_INV

info: If true, actions (like "Read", "Smoke", "Wrap tighter") will be displayed next to the corresponding items.
name: INV_USE_ACTION_NAMES

info: If true, directional actions ( like "Examine", "Open", "Pickup" ) will autoselect an adjacent tile if there is exactly one valid target.
name: AUTOSELECT_SINGLE_VALID_TARGET

info: Highlight selected item's contents and parent container in inventory screen.  "Symbol" shows a highlighted caret and "Highlight" uses font highlighting.
default: Default: symbol - Values: symbol, highlight, disable
name: INVENTORY_HIGHLIGHT

info: If true, highlight unread recipes to allow tracking of newly learned recipes.
name: HIGHLIGHT_UNREAD_RECIPES

info: Allows diagonal movement with cursor keys using CTRL and SHIFT modifiers.  Diagonal movement action keys are taken from keybindings, so you need these to be configured.
default: Default: none - Values: none, mode1, mode2, mode3, mode4
name: DIAG_MOVE_WITH_MODIFIERS_MODE

info: If true, vehicle parts will change color if they are armor plated.
name: VEHICLE_ARMOR_COLOR

info: If true, view will automatically shift towards the driving direction.
name: DRIVING_VIEW_OFFSET

info: If true, when controlling a vehicle, a white 'X' (in curses version) or a crosshair (in tiles version) at distance 10 from the center will display its current facing.
name: VEHICLE_DIR_INDICATOR

info: If true, when driving a vehicle in reverse, steering should also reverse like real life.
name: REVERSE_STEERING

info: Switch between sidebar on the left or on the right side.  Requires restart.
name: SIDEBAR_POSITION

info: If true, adds an extra space between sidebar panels.
name: SIDEBAR_SPACERS

info: Where new log messages should show.
name: LOG_FLOW

info: Number of turns after which a message will be removed from the sidebar log.  0 = disabled.
name: MESSAGE_TTL

info: Number of turns during which similar messages are hidden.  0 = disabled.
name: MESSAGE_COOLDOWN

info: Number of messages to preserve in the history, and when saving.
name: MESSAGE_LIMIT

info: If true, pressing a key with no set function will not display a notice in the chat log.
name: NO_UNKNOWN_COMMAND_MSG

info: Whether to trigger a popup window when completing an achievement.  First: when completing an achievement that has not been completed in a previous game.
default: Default: first - Values: never, always, first
name: ACHIEVEMENT_COMPLETED_POPUP

info: Switch between look around panel being left or right.
name: LOOKAROUND_POSITION

info: How should confidence and steadiness be communicated to the player.
name: ACCURACY_DISPLAY

info: Morale display style in sidebar.
name: MORALE_STYLE

info: If true, Advanced Inventory Manager menu will fit full screen, otherwise it will leave sidebar visible.
name: AIM_WIDTH

info: Move view by how many squares per keypress.
name: MOVE_VIEW_OFFSET

info: With Fast Scroll option enabled, shift view on the overmap and while looking around by this many squares per keypress.
name: FAST_SCROLL_OFFSET

info: If true, menus will start scrolling in the center of the list, and keep the list centered.
name: MENU_SCROLL

info: Centered or to edge, shift the view toward the selected item if it is outside of your current viewport.
default: Default: centered - Values: false, centered, edge
name: SHIFT_LIST_ITEM_VIEW

info: Enabled: automatically assign letters to any carried items that lack them.  Disabled: do not auto-assign letters.  Favorites: only auto-assign letters to favorited items.
default: Default: favorites - Values: disabled, enabled, favorites
name: AUTO_INV_ASSIGN

info: Show item health bars, descriptions like reinforced, scratched etc. or both.
default: Default: bars - Values: bars, descriptions, both
name: ITEM_HEALTH

info: If true, show item symbols in inventory and pick up menu.
name: ITEM_SYMBOLS

info: If true, show a visual representation of armor coverage in the item info window.
name: ITEM_BODYGRAPH

info: Where to place mark of the favorited item (asterisk): before item's name (prefix) or after item's name (suffix).
name: ASTERISK_POSITION

info: If true, enable input from joystick.
name: ENABLE_JOYSTICK

info: Show: cursor is always shown.  Hide: cursor is hidden.  HideKB: cursor is hidden on keyboard input and unhidden on mouse movement.
default: Default: show - Values: show, hide, hidekb
name: HIDE_CURSOR

info: Edge scrolling with the mouse.
name: EDGE_SCROLL

info: If true, will display enabled animations.
name: ANIMATIONS

info: If true, will display weather animations.
name: ANIMATION_RAIN

info: If true, will display animations for projectiles like bullets, arrows, and thrown items.
name: ANIMATION_PROJECTILES

info: If true, will display scrolling combat text animations.
name: ANIMATION_SCT

info: If true, will display scrolling combat text with Unicode font.
name: ANIMATION_SCT_USE_FONT

info: The amount of time to pause between animation frames in ms.
name: ANIMATION_DELAY

info: The speed of every blinking effects in ms.
name: BLINK_SPEED

info: If true, forces the game to redraw at least once per turn.
name: FORCE_REDRAW

info: If true, shows an ASCII graphic on the title screen.  If false, shows a text-only title screen.
name: ENABLE_ASCII_TITLE

info: If true, the title screen will use the art appropriate for the season.
name: SEASONAL_TITLE

info: Set the probability of the alternate title screen appearing.
name: ALT_TITLE

info: Set the size of the terminal along the X axis.
name: TERMINAL_X

info: Set the size of the terminal along the Y axis.
name: TERMINAL_Y

info: If true, vector fonts may look better.
name: FONT_BLENDING

info: Set the font width.  Requires restart.
name: FONT_WIDTH

info: Set the font height.  Requires restart.
name: FONT_HEIGHT

info: Set the font size.  Requires restart.
name: FONT_SIZE

info: Set the map font width.  Requires restart.
name: MAP_FONT_WIDTH

info: Set the map font height.  Requires restart.
name: MAP_FONT_HEIGHT

info: Set the map font size.  Requires restart.
name: MAP_FONT_SIZE

info: Set the overmap font width.  Requires restart.
name: OVERMAP_FONT_WIDTH

info: Set the overmap font height.  Requires restart.
name: OVERMAP_FONT_HEIGHT

info: Set the overmap font size.  Requires restart.
name: OVERMAP_FONT_SIZE

info: If true, use SDL ASCII line drawing routine instead of Unicode Line Drawing characters.  Use this option when your selected font doesn't contain necessary glyphs.
name: USE_DRAW_ASCII_LINES_ROUTINE

info: If true, item and monster description will show a picture of the object in ASCII art when available.
name: ENABLE_ASCII_ART

info: If true, replaces some TTF rendered text with tiles.
name: USE_TILES

info: Choose the tileset you want to use.
default: Default: ASCIITiles - Values: ASCIITiles, ASCII_Overmap, brownlikebears, Cuteclysm, giantdays, Larwick Overmap, neodays, retrodays, SmashButton_iso, SurveyorsMap
name: TILES

info: If true, when very zoomed out you will use a separate tileset.
name: USE_DISTANT_TILES

info: Choose the tileset you want to use for far zoom.
default: Default: ASCIITiles - Values: ASCIITiles, ASCII_Overmap, brownlikebears, Cuteclysm, giantdays, Larwick Overmap, neodays, retrodays, SmashButton_iso, SurveyorsMap
name: DISTANT_TILES

info: Choose when you should swap tileset (lower is more zoomed out).
name: SWAP_ZOOM

info: If true, replaces some TTF-rendered text with tiles for overmap display.
name: USE_OVERMAP_TILES

info: Choose the overmap tileset you want to use.
default: Default: Larwick Overmap - Values: ASCIITiles, ASCII_Overmap, brownlikebears, Cuteclysm, giantdays, Larwick Overmap, neodays, retrodays, SurveyorsMap
name: OVERMAP_TILES

info: If true, toggle the color overlay from night vision goggles and other similar tools.
name: NV_GREEN_TOGGLE

info: Specify the overlay in which the memory map is drawn.  Requires restart.  For custom overlay, define RGB values for dark and bright colors as well as gamma.
default: Default: color_pixel_sepia_light - Values: color_pixel_darken, color_pixel_sepia_light, color_pixel_sepia_dark, color_pixel_blue_dark, color_pixel_custom
name: MEMORY_MAP_MODE

info: Specify RGB value for color RED for dark color overlay.
name: MEMORY_RGB_DARK_RED

info: Specify RGB value for color GREEN for dark color overlay.
name: MEMORY_RGB_DARK_GREEN

info: Specify RGB value for color BLUE for dark color overlay.
name: MEMORY_RGB_DARK_BLUE

info: Specify RGB value for color RED for bright color overlay.
name: MEMORY_RGB_BRIGHT_RED

info: Specify RGB value for color GREEN for bright color overlay.
name: MEMORY_RGB_BRIGHT_GREEN

info: Specify RGB value for color BLUE for bright color overlay.
name: MEMORY_RGB_BRIGHT_BLUE

info: Specify gamma value for overlay.
name: MEMORY_GAMMA

info: If true, shows the pixel-detail minimap in game after the save is loaded.  Use the 'Toggle Pixel Minimap' action key to change its visibility during gameplay.
name: PIXEL_MINIMAP

info: Specified the mode in which the minimap drawn.
default: Default: dots - Values: solid, squares, dots
name: PIXEL_MINIMAP_MODE

info: Overall brightness of pixel-detail minimap.
name: PIXEL_MINIMAP_BRIGHTNESS

info: Height of pixel-detail minimap, measured in terminal rows.  Set to 0 for default spacing.
name: PIXEL_MINIMAP_HEIGHT

info: If true, scale pixel minimap to fit its surroundings.  May produce crappy results, especially in modes other than "Solid".
name: PIXEL_MINIMAP_SCALE_TO_FIT

info: If true, preserves the square shape of tiles shown on the pixel minimap.
name: PIXEL_MINIMAP_RATIO

info: Controls how big the creature beacons are.  Value is in minimap tiles.
name: PIXEL_MINIMAP_BEACON_SIZE

info: Controls how fast the hostile creature beacons blink on the pixel minimap.  Value is multiplied by 200ms.  0 = disabled.
name: PIXEL_MINIMAP_BLINK

info: What color the minimap background should be.  Either based on color theme or (0,0,0) black.
name: PIXEL_MINIMAP_BG

info: Sets which video display will be used to show the game.  Requires restart.
name: DISPLAY

info: Starts Cataclysm in one of the fullscreen modes.  Requires restart.
default: Default: windowedbl - Values: no, maximized, fullscreen, windowedbl
name: FULLSCREEN

info: Set which renderer to use.  Requires restart.
default: Default: software - Values: software, opengles2, opengles
name: RENDERER

info: If true, use render batching for 2D render API to make it more efficient.  Requires restart.
name: RENDER_BATCHING

info: If true, use hardware acceleration for the framebuffer when using software rendering.  Requires restart.
name: FRAMEBUFFER_ACCEL

info: If true, tries to use color modulated textures to speed-up ASCII drawing.  Requires restart.
name: USE_COLOR_MODULATED_TEXTURES

info: Sets the scaling mode, 'none' (default) displays at the game's native resolution, 'nearest' uses low-quality but fast scaling, and 'linear' provides high-quality scaling.
default: Default: none - Values: none, nearest, linear
name: SCALING_MODE

info: Factor by which to scale the display.  Requires restart.
name: SCALING_FACTOR

info: Handling of game world when last character dies.
default: Default: reset - Values: reset, delete, query, keep
name: WORLD_END

info: A number determining how large cities are.  A higher number means larger cities.  0 disables cities, roads and any scenario requiring a city start.
name: CITY_SIZE

info: A number determining how far apart cities are.  A higher number means cities are further apart.  Warning, small numbers lead to very slow mapgen.
name: CITY_SPACING

info: A scaling factor that determines density of monster spawns.  A higher number means more monsters.
name: SPAWN_DENSITY

info: A scaling factor that determines density of item spawns.  A higher number means more items.
name: ITEM_SPAWNRATE

info: Baseline average number of days between random NPC spawns.  Average duration goes up with the number of NPCs already spawned.  A higher number means fewer NPCs.  Set to 0 days to disable random NPCs.
name: NPC_SPAWNTIME

info: A scaling factor that determines the time between monster upgrades.  A higher number means slower evolution.  Set to 0.00 to turn off monster upgrades.
name: MONSTER_UPGRADE_FACTOR

info: Determines the movement rate of monsters.  A higher value increases monster speed and a lower reduces it.  Requires world reset.
name: MONSTER_SPEED

info: Determines how much damage monsters can take.  A higher value makes monsters more resilient and a lower makes them more flimsy.  Requires world reset.
name: MONSTER_RESILIENCE

info: (WIP feature) Determines terrain, shops, plants, and more.
name: DEFAULT_REGION

info: Season length, in days.  Warning: Very little other than the duration of seasons scales with this value, so adjusting it may cause nonsensical results.
name: SEASON_LENGTH

info: Sets the time of construction in percents.  '50' is two times faster than default, '200' is two times longer.  '0' automatically scales construction time to match the world's season length.
name: CONSTRUCTION_SCALING

info: If true, keep the initial season for ever.
name: ETERNAL_SEASON

info: Day/night cycle settings.  'Normal' sets a normal cycle.  'Eternal Day' sets eternal day.  'Eternal Night' sets eternal night.
default: Default: normal - Values: normal, day, night
name: ETERNAL_TIME_OF_DAY

info: If true, emulates zombie hordes.  Zombies can group together into hordes, which can wander around cities and will sometimes move towards noise.  Note: the current implementation does not properly respect obstacles, so hordes can appear to walk through walls under some circumstances.  Must reset world directory after changing for it to take effect.
name: WANDER_SPAWNS

info: If true, spawn zombies at shelters.  Makes the starting game a lot harder.
name: BLACK_ROAD

info: If true, radiation causes the player to mutate.
name: RAD_MUTATION

info: Allowed point pools for character generation.
default: Default: story_teller - Values: any, multi_pool, story_teller
name: CHARACTER_POINT_POOLS

info: Will you need to complete certain achievements to enable certain scenarios and professions?  Achievements are tracked from your memorial file so characters from any world will be checked.  Disabling this will spoil factions and situations you may otherwise stumble upon naturally.  Some scenarios are frustrating for the uninitiated and some professions skip portions of the games content.  If new to the game meta progression will help you be introduced to mechanics at a reasonable pace.
name: META_PROGRESS

info: Determines the scope, which is known in the beginning of the game.
name: DISTANCE_INITIAL_VISIBILITY

info: Initial points available to spend on stats on character generation.
name: INITIAL_STAT_POINTS

info: Initial points available to spend on traits on character generation.
name: INITIAL_TRAIT_POINTS

info: Initial points available to spend on skills on character generation.
name: INITIAL_SKILL_POINTS

info: Maximum trait points available for character generation.
name: MAX_TRAIT_POINTS

info: In character creation will show the underlying value that is used to determine difficulty.
name: DEBUG_DIFFICULTIES

info: Scales experience gained from practicing skills and reading books.  0.5 is half as fast as default, 2.0 is twice as fast, 0.0 disables skill training except for NPC training.
name: SKILL_TRAINING_SPEED

info: Scales experience gained from practicing proficiencies.  0.5 is half as fast as default, 2.0 is twice as fast, 0.0 disables proficiency training except for NPC training.
name: PROFICIENCY_TRAINING_SPEED

info: If true and the world is in Z-level mode, the vision will extend beyond current Z-level.  If false, vision is limited to current Z-level.
name: FOV_3D

info: How many levels up and down the experimental 3D field of vision reaches and is drawn on screen.  (This many levels up, this many levels down.)  3D vision of the full height of the world can slow the game down a lot.  Seeing fewer Z-levels is faster.
name: FOV_3D_Z_RANGE

info: Draw walls normal (Off), retracted/transparent (On), or automatically retracting/transparent near player (Auto).
name: PREVENT_OCCLUSION

info: Prevent occlusion by using semi-transparent sprites.
name: PREVENT_OCCLUSION_TRANSP

info: Prevent occlusion by retracting high sprites.
name: PREVENT_OCCLUSION_RETRACT

info: Minimum distance for auto occlusion handling.  Values above zero overwrite tileset settings.
name: PREVENT_OCCLUSION_MIN_DIST

info: Maximum distance for auto occlusion handling.  Values above zero overwrite tileset settings.
name: PREVENT_OCCLUSION_MAX_DIST
